channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.description:
Report X-2023120967

Ops manager was called over to inspect the package DescribePack: The package was spoiled at the bottom and had open closures. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Follow instructions for the damage hazmat process step by step. 2. X-2023120992 SequenceEvent: The Package came to QA damages soiled. Ops manager was called over to inspect the package. DescribePack: The package was soiled at the bottom with open closures. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Follow instructions for the damage hazmat process step by step. 3. X-2023120996 SequenceEvent: The package came to QA damages soiled. Ops manager was called over to inspect the package. DescribePack: The package was soiled at the bottom with open closures DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Follow instructions for the damage hazmat process step by step.

item.title: Report E-2023120416
item.description:
Report E-2023120416

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 19, 2023, one (1) 5-liter jug of hydrogen peroxide was punctured by a forklift and released less than three (<3) liters of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the hydrogen peroxide-impacted trailer interior/dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged jug were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023121009
item.description:
Report X-2023121009

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: GROVELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/15/2023 at approximately 1345 , Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 68727 at the station location in Groveland, reporting a herbicide spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic container that shipped inside of a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered leaking, initially the cause was unknown. The shipment was discovered leaking during delivery and was returned to the station, Further investigation revealed that the top was not secure on the bottle, causing the spillage. An online safety data sheet was located by Dangerous Goods Administration and it revealed that the commodity was classified as a regulated corrosive shipment, though not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023120551
item.description:
Report X-2023120551

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO WET PACKAGE WITH HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS AND HAZORD DIAMOND LABEL. RESPONDER TRANSFERED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA AND PROCESSED USING SODIUM BICARBONATE AND ZEP ZORBENT WHILE WEARING GOOGLES, ARPRON, BOOTS AND SILVERSHIELD INSIDE GLOVES.
